question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I developed ways of thinking on the fly. I also developed knowledge about the art of public speaking and methods of giving great speeches.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned how to refine the music of my voice, specifically how to better project, soften, and enunciate when I delivered speaking messages. I was also enlightened to the value of public speaking as a means of being my authentic self and as a means of change in advocating for the issues I am passionate about. Finally, and most importantly, I was motivated to continually take advantage of opportunities to become a better public speaker and develop this skill for the remainder of my academic and professional career.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned to slow down and take up space when speaking.I learned to anticipate that everyone has stories to tell, more than you think.I learned that memorization is not the key to successful preparation.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: The course was constructive in the teaching of effective speaking methods for beginners. With classmates on my side, I was able to separate out my strengths and weaknesses. Through weekly practices, I explored different speaking measures and improved as a unique speaker.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
1. Audience considerations, learning how to appeal to an audience through emotion, logic, gesture, and your voice. Learning how to persuade and even please opposing audiences was quite helpful.
2. Professionalism and colloquialism, learning how to build an image and perception around your words.
3. Building a narrative for yourself, how to create a meaningful story and progression

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
1) The specific tools to pull together to make delivering a speech effective: talking slowly, making eye contact, not memorizing, being genuine, and believing in your own points
2) The skill of observing other people's speeches and learning what to look for and how to better apply that to myself
3) Confidence. I learned how to trust myself fully, what my strengths in speaking are and how they are intertwined with a bit of creativity, and I learned just how much you can learn from others and learn from yourself simply by giving a speech.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Public speaking; using my voice to advocate for causes I care about; musicality of my voice

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Ability to deliver a speech more calmly and effectively; techniques of speech-making and speech-writing; effective listening and new methods of communication

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
1) some tips for public speaking through the textbook
2) heard interesting stories of all the other classmates
3) gained some public speaking experiences

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
I learned the art of breathing even while under any form of pressure on stage.  
I learned how to maintain a poised nature and posture on stage. It has helped me deal with nervousness. 
I have acquired skills on how to maintain my pace when delivering a speech. Through this, I realized that there is nothing wrong with taking my time while speaking. It is never wasting anyone's time.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned to approach challenges in a more optimistic outlook. When it came to public speaking, I was terrified of presenting and dreaded the thought of sharing my thoughts in front of an audience. Yet, through this class, I learned that a chance to speak was an opprotunity to express myself. There are many skills I could reflect on such as I need to speak with confidence, make eye contact with the audience, emphasize important terms, speak clearly and do not rush when you are speaking. Lastly, I want to empahsize that public speaking is best conducted when you view it as an opportunity rather than a burden, it is all about your mindset and how you approach your speech.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
1. I developed an understanding of public speaking etiquette and procedures.
2. I learned about impromptu speech techniques.
3. I developed active listening and note-taking skills.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I greatly improved in my public speaking abilities, through providing constructive criticism to my classmates and through activities that pushed me out of my comfort zone. One of the most impactful aspects of this class was learning about my peers' passions, as it reignited my desire to make positive change in the world. Finally, I greatly improved my note taking skills, and learned to condense information to make it more digestible.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: In this course, I learned how to effectively give public speeches. I acquired methods on how to make speeches engaging and captivating, and I learned how to properly format and prepare for speeches.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: How to prepare and deliver a speech. What makes a good public speaker.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: How to effectively capture ideas and take notes, how to make notes for speaking and in general visually accessible with spacing, bulleting, font, etc., and great insight from my classmates about their experiences and perspectives.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Through reflecting on chapter summaries, I was able to refine my understanding of what makes good public speakers and effective speeches. Applying these learned skills through various speaking activities was the most effective way of reinforcing my learning. The unique speaking assignments that put me in different situations every week was not only fun, but intellectually challenging and stimulating as I had to stay on my toes, adapt, and recall the skills I had learned.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The weekly speaking assignments forced practice. The feedback from other students was especially helpful, both compliments and critiques.I enjoyed when Professor would talk about her life's stories and experiences and impart wisdom. This freeform time was very valuable.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: It was important to read chapters every week so that we could equip ourselves with a good theoretical basis in a quick fashion. Although there are skills the book mentioned that we never practiced, it was reassuring to learn new things before we made new speeches.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The instructor structured the class exceptionally in the fact that it became a safe space for many, if not all of the students. Course components such as impromptu speeches and rehearsed speeches build constructive instruction.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Professor Byerly was very hands-on in her teaching style for half the class, in terms of telling personal life stories and life tips that have brought her here, but also gave us space consistently to fly our own wings nearly every class when we were sent to the podium to speak. I would say don't change a thing. The class is beautifully structured in a way that allows everyone to form bonds and be proud of eachother.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I liked the public speaking exercises that we had every week - they gave us opportunities to speak in front of a group and become comfortable with it

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The structure of learning where we write our speeches and presented them in the ways we would like to speak them (visually accessible) has helped me improve my writing skills.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: This class was a very inclusive experience in which we all, students and professor, shared stories, experiences, and knowledge with one another in a relaxed and sometimes stressful environment. The way that the course was set up was that we were able to freely share our thoughts in a conversational manner. When it came down to giving speeches, we approached the podium, delievered our talk, and continued on with the lesson, which was a bit more stressful. I think the relaxed manner the course was taught in made learning less of a task and more of an experience. When Dr. Byerly would share her life stories and experiences, it made the lessons more personalized, which made the content and learning experience memorable and more valuable for future years of learning.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The instructor was incredibly engaging and willing to clarify our needs or concerns. I appreciated that the course was flexible in how we were allowed to take the content we produced for written and spoken assignments. The speech "feedback" system was also helpful in enabling us to learn from our peers. Overall, the course had an environment of "freedom" that allowed for rich intellectual engagement with public speaking.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I think that listening to my classmates speak was a key course component that helped me to improve my speaking. It helped me realize what was possible for me, and gave me inspiration for new speaking techniques to try. I also appreciated the constructive criticism from the instructor each time we presented at the podium, as it gave us the opportunity to improve for the next assignment.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The environment of this class was very social and comfortable. I enjoyed all of the stories and experiences Dr. Byerly has, and there was definitely a lesson in all of them. I appreciate the tight bond I have with all my classmates, as it made me feel comfortable to engage in public speaking and less afraid of messing up. Due to our tight bonds, my classmates were able to give constructive criticism and words of encouragement that were especially catered to me.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The most stimulating aspect of the class was preparing and delivering different types of speeches each week, which forced me to be on my toes. I also felt really engaged by Professor Byerly's stories. The connections between her personal, professional, and academic life and public speaking were inspiring and continue to motivate me to stay true to myself while still growing as a public speaker.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: This class was stimulating because it focused on what we could learn from each other. The textbook readings and summaries were rather rote and prosaic. I'm glad we didn't spend to much time on those in class but I think we could use less of that.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: It was stimulating because the professor challenged us on our performances, and offered advice that were constructive but not imposing.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The ability to have to think on your feet, be pushed out of your comfort zone, and listen deeply to your peers. It was super cool to see the evolution of everyone's speaking skills over time.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The process of peer evaluation really cultivates me into a critical listener. The course also offers a safe space to challenge my limits.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The fact that I was able to come out of my comfort zone and think of things that I love, things that are meaningful to me and things that I hold close and dear to me.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: There was constant conversation and assignments which made the entirety of the class engaging. It was important to constantly pay attention so you would not miss out on important life advise or tips on how to be a public speaker.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The TED talk and the weekly assignments were very intellectually stimulating, however the chapter readings and re-typing of class notes felt more like busy work. Some of my favorite assignments were the living eulogy, TED talk, and list of things we love.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: Every class, I was entirely engaged despite it being 2 hours and 30 minutes. I felt that I improved every class and was able to learn from my mistakes.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Initially, the class can feel overwhelming because of how much we refine our previous approaches to public speaking. Nonetheless, class activities are incredibly rewarding and its very gratifying to see how much I have grown as a speaker since the very first class.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I was able to rethink my own intrinsic biases towards race, work with people on group projects in a more efficient manner, and was able to improve my own historical writing skills

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: The greatest takeaway from this course is that anthropologists have played a formidable role in racial formation in the United States. This class challenged common misconceptions about race. For example, many people believe that there are genetic differences between the races, but on a genetic level, every human is more similar than they are different. Race is a social construct, created by an elite group of white people to subjugate and dehumanize other people. Though genetic races are a myth, society has been built around the idea that race is real, making its consequences very real and tangible.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
- I learned more about the creation of race and racism in the United States.
- I learned about how racism affects those who are living in the world now.
- I learned how race is not biological, but it is a social and political tool that has influence over science, healthcare, public policy, and other fields.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I believe this course helped develop my ability to think quickly, as there were times in the class when we would take place in events and mini-research projects without any knowledge prior. My writing had improved, specifically when identifying what parts in a paper/essay were the most important and providing sufficient evidence for that. I also believe considering Dr. Baker's involved position within Duke, he was very transparent about the conversations occurring among faculty and how this directly related to the topics we were going over in class, which allowed students to see how what we were studying was still occurring in our daily lives.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I engaged with topics that my high school teachers were afraid to even mention, including systemic racism, the legacy of slavery, and the violent discrimination that many minority groups have faced in this country. I learned about the origins of racial categories and the dark history of the field of anthropology. I read books and articles, watched documentaries, and presented my own research on the content in this course.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I feel that the instructor facilitated learning through class discussions, various different activities in class and through interesting readings. I will take the readings and perspectives on contemporary issues the class taught me for the future.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Most classes were lecture style with some class discussion throughout. Professor Baker loved in-class presentations and assignments. He's also really big on partner work. For future years, I'd keep lecture style as I feel it works best for this class.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I think the readings allowed us to go into more depth about the topics we were going over in class.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I enjoyed the interactive elements of the class, where we would either go out of the classroom, conduct impromptu research, or present the readings in class with discussion questions. All of these were highlights of the class that I remember the most and aided greatly in my learning the material.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The course was much more lecture-based than I had anticipated. I did not mind this style, but I do wish we had more opportunities for class reflection and discussion. I appreciated the detailed, user-friendly syllabus and would definitely continue to provide that in the coming years.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The class was made stimulating by the unpredictable nature of the content for the day, as most of the content covered topics foreign to me.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The conversations regarding race were incredibly stimulating, and have given me a new perspective on race relations in social settings as well as how race inspired policy and law.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: It caused me to learn new things about the effects of race in our country.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: Similar to what I've said prior, the class was intellectually stimulating with the many modes of studying as well as the themes that were directly related to current-day affairs.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: This class was stimulating because it connected real-world issues that my peers and I were familiar with and connected those issues to the grand field of anthropology, placing these issues in a historical context so we may better understand how our current race-based world came to be. Moreover, Professor Baker's enthusiasm and knowledge regarding the content made the class even more stimulating.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: The course will initially be foreign and kind of weird, but over time the course will be incredibly enjoyable.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Baker is a kind and enthusiastic professor who really cares for his students. He's passionate about anthropology and it comes out through his lecture style. Sometimes his lectures are unorganized which makes the content confusing, and his instructions for assignments often lack clarity. He doesn't love rubrics, which most students love and prefer to have. Overall, the class is worth taking keeping Baker's quirks in mind.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: I think it is important to pay attention in class and focus on the what the readings are trying to communicate.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: It is a wonderful course that will open your mind. Not only will the material interest you, but I believe Dr. Baker may fascinate you more with his eccentric personality and keen insights. The TAs are also extremely helpful both in and outside the classroom and can provide their own experiences as FOCUS students.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Rate My Professors can sometimes be harsh, so take some of those reviews with a grain of salt. It is easy to succeed in the course if you do the readings, attend class, ask questions, write the papers, and study for the exams. Finally, the "unessay" at the end of the course is incredibly fun to create and reduces the potential stress that high-stakes finals cause.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned about the African diaspora in the Brazilian context, the history of slavery in Brazil, and the origins and globalization of capoeira as a cultural practice

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned the history and culture of Capoeira through the movement and the music. I learned to properly execute the movements and to properly play multiple instruments.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Critical reading skills, analysis of diverse forms of media: dance, film, and readings and understanding the ways the media interacts with the history of capoeira and the way the themes from the media correlates with the moves and dances we learn in class.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Consideration of transnational identity exchange, conditions and causes of such conditions of life in Brazil, especially considering the context of those who learn and practice capoeira, and methods of analyzing global South histories with regards to cultural exchange and social mobility

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I think the seminar was really interesting since it built upon the reading and previous discussion also built upon previous weeks. The seminars would also let us introduce our ideas and they were never wrong and she transitioned our personal ideas into different parts of history and built upon our original thoughts which lead to greater confidence in ourselves and individual ideas.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Seminar discussions were very open and informative. They were about the readings and discussion posts we did over the previous week, so everyone came in with the knowledge necessary to contribute. Professor Wesolowski was incredibly knowledgeable about Brazilian history and capoeira, having studied in Brazil and researched capoeira for decades. She was incredibly kind, patient, and fostered an environment in class where there were no "silly questions." We could ask what we were interested in, and she genuinely cared about each of us as individuals. She became so excited when we showed passion for the topics. My absolute favorite thing about class is that she would often remember what we wrote in our discussion posts, or details about our personal interests and identities that we brought to the class. She would weave them into class discussions and make them feel a lot more personal. That effort on her part encouraged us all to remain highly engaged with the course.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Katya pushed me to think critically about the ties between capoeira, race, gender, and class. I appreciated that she demonstrated the movements throughout the course.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The instructor helped provide feedback on every discussion post and further provided context and slides that complemented the reading that we did.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The four films we watched were very useful in exploring the histories and context of capoeira, especially the myths vs the facts of capoeira. Seeing the history of the game and its players gave me a far more in depth understanding of the practice, especially considering capoeira Angola versus regional, plus the histories of those practicing outside of Brazil
